page.title: 01DOWLISH WAKE, SOUTH SOMERSET
page.content: This is an area of very broken country dropping away to the North of a high ridge, rising again, slightly, to a more level area running NW to SE. It contains three small villages and a number of farming hamlets, the NW corner just touches the residential outskirts of the town of Ilminster. The land cover is predominantly pasture, a mixture of enclosed rough grazing in the bottoms of the coombs and valleys, becoming intensively managed grassland as the land rises and levels out. On the higher area the land cover becomes arable with a variety of grains and root crops, including potatoes, and commercial orchard. There is a small amount of mainly deciduous woodland and a large number of hedgerow trees.
